sentences.en: Cannon rumbled in the distance, very far away but unmistakably cannon.
sentences.cn: 远处有了炮声, 很远,但清清楚楚的是炮声.

sentences.en: Cannon's film impresses on many levels.
sentences.cn: 坎农的电影在很多方面令人印象深刻。

sentences.en: Certain cannon shots in the Federal war cost 1,000 dollars apiece.
sentences.cn: 南北战争时期,有的炮弹值一千美元一发.

sentences.en: Forever, thunder would mean cannon and war to her.
sentences.cn: 从那以后, 她总是一听到雷声便连想起大炮和战争来了.

sentences.en: Max is a loose cannon politically.
sentences.cn: 马克斯在政治上我行我素。

sentences.en: Now all the fighter planes are all armed with cannon.
sentences.cn: 现在所有的战斗机都装备了机关炮.

sentences.en: She was driven off by cannon shot.
The bullets and cannon - balls were flying in all directions.
The cannon thundered in the hills.
The cannons boom, the band plays.
The conscripts were treated as cannon fodder.
sentences.cn: 应征入伍者被当做炮灰。

sentences.en: The front gate was blasted open with a cannon.
The stillness of night was broken by the boom of a cannon.
sentences.cn: 夜晚的寂静被隆隆的炮声打破。

sentences.en: We heard the bang of a cannon.
sentences.cn: 我们听到轰的一声炮响.

words.tran_cn: 大炮；[军]加农炮；榴弹炮；机关炮

phrases.tran_cn: 我行我素不顾后果的人

trans.tran_en: a large heavy powerful gun that was used in the past to fire heavy metal balls
